page.title: 11NEW ROMNEY CHURCHES OF PAST
page.content: WHEN THE FIRST DOMESDAY BOOK WAS WRITTEN A RECORD WAS MADE OF FIVE CHURCHES ALL OF THEM QUITE WEALTHY. THEY WERE ALL RULED BY THE ABBOT OF A MONASTERY IN NORMANDY.THE PRIESTS WERE CHOSEN BY HIM AND HAD FRENCH NAMES.THE FIVE CHURCHES WERE ST NICHOLAS ST MARTIN'S ST LAWRENCE,ST JOHN'S AND ST JOHN'S PRIORY.THEY WERE MADE OF STONE FROM FRANCE.ST NICHOLAS STILL STANDS TODAY.THE OTHERS WERE KNOCKED DOWN WHEN THEY WENT SHORT OF MONEY.THE RIVER ROTHER ENTERED THE SEA BESIDE THE CHURCH BECAUSE NEW ROMNEY WAS A PORT.IN 1287 THERE WAS A BAD STORM AND MUD AND PEBBLES BLOCKED THE MOUTH AND THE RIVER CHANGED IT'S COURSE AND WENT BY RYE.THE SITES OF THE OLD CHURCHES ST JOHN'S AND ST LAWRENCE ARE NOW COVERED BY HOUSES.
